item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Wednesday, September 18, 2024 at 2:15 PM UTC
item.description:
1. Why wordfreq will not be updated (402 points | 90 comments)
2. Apple mobile processors are now made in America by TSMC (1051 points | 465 comments)
3. Independent directors of 23andMe resign from board (497 points | 261 comments)
4. Scramble: Open-Source Alternative to Grammarly (303 points | 129 comments)
5. Atkinson Hyperlegible Font (621 points | 175 comments)
6. Papermill: Parameterizing, executing, and analyzing Jupyter Notebooks (3 points | 1 comment)
7. Gentle Guide to Self-Hosting (58 points | 17 comments)
8. React for R (71 points | 34 comments)
9. macOS Sequoia 15 may bypass DNS encryption (492 points | 166 comments)
10. Show HN: sol – A de-minifier for shell programs (94 points | 5 comments)
11. AI tool cuts unexpected deaths in hospital by 26%, Canadian study finds (14 points | 1 comment)
12. How Raw sockets behave differently in macOS and Linux (54 points | 13 comments)
13. Errors from `Close` (16 points | 3 comments)
14. GraalPy – A high-performance embeddable Python 3 runtime for Java (288 points | 122 comments)
15. Rga: Ripgrep, but also search in PDFs, E-Books, Office documents, zip, etc. (464 points | 52 comments)
16. Tupperware files for bankruptcy as its colorful containers lose relevance (7 points | 1 comment)
17. Asgard launches world's first DDR5-9600 DIMMs (62 points | 29 comments)
18. A Friendly Introduction to Assembly for High-Level Programmers (205 points | 29 comments)
19. Reports of the death of dental cavities are greatly exaggerated (154 points | 93 comments)
20. Emerge Tools (YC W21) is hiring a senior front end engineer ( | hide)
21. Show HN: Open Scanner, an open-source document scanning app for iPhone (234 points | 75 comments)
22. The Lego Great Ball Contraption (262 points | 42 comments)
23. John Peralta Explodes Historic Technology into Three-Dimensional Diagrams (80 points | 10 comments)
24. Crypto bros wrested Flappy Bird from its creator (47 points | 10 comments)
25. OpenTelemetry Tracing in < 200 lines of code (205 points | 27 comments)
26. Rustpad is an efficient and minimal open-source collaborative text editor (75 points | 10 comments)
27. NetWare NFS Gateway 1.1 (15 points | 5 comments)
28. Implement algorithms that minimize slippage (50 points | 5 comments)
29. Hezbollah pager explosions kill several people in Lebanon (958 points | 2163 comments)
30. Launch HN: Marblism (YC W24) – Generate full-stack web apps from a prompt (122 points | 84 comments)
item.guid: Hacker News Top Stories: Wednesday, September 18, 2024 at 2:15 PM UTC
